Learn how to handle forms effectively us: Learn how to handle forms effectively using React Hook Form with Zod validation.
This guide explains how to build type-sa: This guide explains how to build type-safe forms with validation using React Hook Form and Zod. These patterns ensure data integrity before sending to the API and provide clear feedback to users.
Use this guide when you need to:: Use this guide when you need to:

Dynamic fields are complex to manage: Dynamic fields are complex to manage
The form system uses a layered component: The form system uses a layered component architecture:
Context provider that wraps the entire f: Context provider that wraps the entire form (uses FormProvider from react-hook-form)
Connects a field to form state using Con: Connects a field to form state using Controller
Container for a single form field (label: Container for a single form field (label, input, error)
Label that auto-connects to the field an: Label that auto-connects to the field and shows error state
Passes form field props to the input ele: Passes form field props to the input element

Solution: Create a custom wrapper compon: Solution: Create a custom wrapper component that uses shadcn/ui Form components.

The Form components from shadcn/ui provi: The Form components from shadcn/ui provide context-based error handling:
FormField wraps Controller and provides: FormField wraps Controller and provides field context
name: props.name: name: props.name
useFormField hook retrieves field state: useFormField hook retrieves field state from context
FormItem provides unique ID via context: FormItem provides unique ID via context
FormLabel shows error state via color: FormLabel shows error state via color
FormControl passes aria attributes for a: FormControl passes aria attributes for accessibility
FormMessage automatically displays error: FormMessage automatically displays error from context

Problem: Managing array of fields with v: Problem: Managing array of fields with validation is complex.
Solution: useFieldArray provides add, re: Solution: useFieldArray provides add, remove, and update methods with proper validation.

Scenario: Form shows different fields ba: Scenario: Form shows different fields based on payment method selection.
Problem: Need to watch a field value and: Problem: Need to watch a field value and conditionally render other fields.
Solution: useWatch subscribes to field c: Solution: useWatch subscribes to field changes without causing full form re-render.

Scenario: Submit form data to API and ha: Scenario: Submit form data to API and handle success/error states.

Scenario: Load existing product data int: Scenario: Load existing product data into form for editing.

Solution: Use Zod refine to validate acr: Solution: Use Zod refine to validate across multiple fields.

Problem: Need to call API to check uniqu: Problem: Need to call API to check uniqueness.
Solution: Use async refine to validate a: Solution: Use async refine to validate against API.
Validate on blur for async validation: Validate on blur for async validation
Why: Keeps validation logic close to the: Why: Keeps validation logic close to the form that uses it.
Choose validation timing based on form c: Choose validation timing based on form complexity:
Validate on submit (default) - best for: Validate on submit (default) - best for simple forms
Validate on blur - best for forms with a: Validate on blur - best for forms with async validation
Validate on change - best for real-time: Validate on change - best for real-time feedback

Solution: Use setError to display server: Solution: Use setError to display server errors on specific fields.
